results.title: Teenage Babylon
results.brief_description: Restaging 1950s and 1960s forensic photographs, director Graeme Wood explores the meanings, memories and possible stories that were undetected at the time. These intimate and poetic portraits reveal how the distance of time itself alters and reconfigures the actual space and meaning of the photograph.

results.title: Teen suicide
results.creator_credit: Cambridge Research Group Limited, Charlotte Angel, Kyle Boyd and Matt Clark
results.brief_description: This program looks at the reasons troubled teenagers consider, attempt or commit suicide. There is an emphasis on recognising the warning signs, the importance of communication, preventative measures and where to go to help. The program features interviews with teenagers who offer insights into the reasons why they felt suicidal and how they dealt with their situations.

results.title: Teddy bears at play [1959]
results.creator_credit: Australian National Travel Association, Mel F. Nichols and Winifred Lade
results.brief_description: A re-issue of a 1939 film, famous for its intimate study of the koala. This quaint and friendly creature with its soft round furry body is the most popular of Austrlia’s unique animals. Photographed by Mel. F. Nichols, edited by Winifred Lade.

results.title: Teddy
results.brief_description: A youthful African American man and his fight for equality for himself and for others through education. He goes to community meetings at South Park and connects with the fringe of the Black Panthers.

results.title: Ted: The Kite Man
results.brief_description: Ted the kite man is a Port Fairy icon. A long time resident, Ted has a kite shop, a big heart, and a contagious philosophy as he encourages kids to explore the winds and the outdoors flying their kites. He and his partner build kites with 3,000 children a year and he believes flying a kite helps you forget all your concerns of the day while participating in this peaceful activity.

results.title: Ted Baryluk's grocery
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Wolf Koenig, Michael Scott, John Paskievich and Mike Mirus
results.brief_description: Ukranian-Canadian Ted Baryluk’s grocery store has been a fixture in Winnipeg’s north end for over 20 years. In this black and white photo study, Ted talks about his store, the customers who have come and gone, and the social changes his multi-cultural neighbourhood has seen. But most of all he wonders what will become of his store when he retires. He hopes his daughter Helen will take over, but she wants to move away. The film is a wistful rendering of a shopkeeper’s relationship with his daughter and a fascinating portrait of a neighbourhood and its inhabitants. (Awards: Yorkton, Chicago, Toronto)

results.title: Tectonics
results.creator_credit: Yorkshire Television, European Broadcasting Union and Ian Rosenbloom
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Planet Earth”.
Program 1 of a 4 part series. Each program is divided into sections for easy classroom viewing using a combination of the latest computer graphics and filmed examples of climatic occurrences to provide a detailed description and explanation of the geographical factors influencing Planet Earth. This video aims to provide a detailed description and explanation of the structure of the earth; plate tectonics; earthquakes at destructive and conservative margins; collision zones; fold mountains; and volcanoes. Includes a teacher’s guide.

results.title: Technology for the 1972 Olympic Games
results.brief_description: To carry out such a world event as the 1972 Olympic Games in Munich, a wide range of the most modern technical devices were necessary. The film highlights some of the technical achievements of the Games, in which Siemens Industries played an important technical role.
